body_html:
I was just wondering that in the conditioned GAN case I could pass generator input as a dictionary whereas the real data has to be a list because dicts are not supported by ops.convert_to_tensor.
For my condition I can pass information like "sequence lengths before padding" along but I cannot do that for the real_data.
body_text:
I was just wondering that in the conditioned GAN case I could pass generator input as a dictionary whereas the real data has to be a list because dicts are not supported by ops.convert_to_tensor.
For my condition I can pass information like "sequence lengths before padding" along but I cannot do that for the real_data.
body:
I was just wondering that in the conditioned GAN case I could pass generator input as a dictionary whereas the real data has to be a list because dicts are not supported by `ops.convert_to_tensor`.
For my condition I can pass information like "sequence lengths before padding" along but I cannot do that for the real_data.
